block.p: An opinionated guide to cultural and recreational goings-on around the state this week. Items may be submitted by mail to On the Towns, Sunday New Jersey Section, The New York Times, 229 West 43d Street, New York, N.Y. 10036; by fax to (212) 556-7219, or by e-mail to njtowns@nytimes.com.
MUSIC

ARTS GUILD OF RAHWAY The ''Millennium Music Series'' featuring Paul Salomone Quartet, with Tommy Gryce. Friday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $10; $8 for students and older people. 1670 Irving Street, Rahway. (732) 381-7511.

COMMUNITY THEATER OF MORRISTOWN Joan Baez. Tuesday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $30 and $37.50. Branford Marsalis. Friday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $25 to $35. Philharmonia of the Nations. Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $20 to $33. 100 South Street, Morristown. (973) 539-8008.

An opinionated guide to cultural and recreational goings-on around the state this week. Items may be submitted by mail to On the Towns, Sunday New Jersey Section, The New York Times, 229 West 43d Street, New York, N.Y. 10036; by fax to (212) 556-7219, or by e-mail to njtowns@nytimes.com.
MUSIC

ARTS GUILD OF RAHWAY The ''Millennium Music Series'' featuring Paul Salomone Quartet, with Tommy Gryce. Friday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $10; $8 for students and older people. 1670 Irving Street, Rahway. (732) 381-7511.

COMMUNITY THEATER OF MORRISTOWN Joan Baez. Tuesday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $30 and $37.50. Branford Marsalis. Friday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $25 to $35. Philharmonia of the Nations. Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $20 to $33. 100 South Street, Morristown. (973) 539-8008.

COUNT BASIE THEATER ''Heartstrings for Hunger'' presents Rockapella, contemporary a capella quintet, in a benefit for the Community Food Bank of New Jersey. Friday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $25, $22, $19. New Jersey Symphony Orchestra, ''Debussy and Brahms,'' Gerard Schwarz, conductor. Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $15 to $61. 99 Monmouth Street, Red Bank. (732) 842-9000.
FAIRLEIGH DICKINSON UNIVERSITY All Seasons Chamber Players, in a program titled ''Fantasy and Phantasm.'' Today at 3 p.m. Free. Edward Williams Hall, 150 Kotte Place, Hackensack. (201) 692-7031.
FIRST PRESBYTERIAN CHURCH Monmouth Arts Foundation's Chamber Music Series, featuring ''Center City Brass.'' Next Sunday at 4 p.m. 255 Harding Road, Red Bank. (732) 747-1348.
HADDONFIELD MEMORIAL HIGH SCHOOL The Haddonfield Symphony, Rossen Milanov, director. Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $25; $15 for students. Auditorium, Haddonfield. (856) 429-1880.

JOHN HARMS CENTER FOR THE ARTS Bergen Philharmonic Orchestra, featuring Makoto Nakura, marimbist, in the world premiere performance of the Concerto for Marimba by Taunya Tanabe. Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $25; $20 for students and older people. 30 North Van Brunt Street, Englewood. (201) 567-3600.

MAHWAH PUBLIC LIBRARY ''American Classics From Kern to Lerner and Loewe,'' featuring Phillip Mentor, baritone, and Beverly Webber, pianist. Today at 2 p.m. Free. 100 Ridge Road, Mahwah. (201) 529-7323.

NEWARK SYMPHONY HALL Roy Ayers and Cynthia Holiday. Today at 5 p.m. Tickets: $15. Terrace Ballroom. ''Sisters in the Spirit,'' featuring Yolanda Adams, Shirley Caesar and Mary, Mary in concert. Friday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $35. Gladys Knight in Concert. Next Sunday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $45 to $60. Sarah Vaughan Concert Hall, 1020 Broad Street, Newark. (973) 643-8009.

NEW JERSEY PERFORMING ARTS CENTER ''Shirley Marshall: A Night to Remember.'' Today at 7:30 p.m. Tickets: $35. Victoria Theater. NDR Symphony Orchestra of Hamburg, Christoph Eschenbach, conductor, Midori, violinist. Today at 3 p.m. Evgeny Kissin, pianist. Wednesday at 7:30 p.m. Tickets: $12 to $49. New Jersey Symphony Orchestra, ''Debussy and Brahms,'' Gerard Schwarz, conductor. Friday at 8 p.m.; next Sunday at 3 p.m. Tickets: $15 to $61. Prudential Hall. 1 Center Street, Newark. (888) 466-5722.
PARAMOUNT THEATER Monmouth Symphony Orchestra. Today at 2:30 p.m. Tickets: $18; $14 for older people. Sunset Avenue, Asbury Park. (732) 918-6676.

PEDDIE SCHOOL ''Junk Music,'' featuring Donald Knaack, percussionist. Saturday at 2 p.m. Tickets: $8. William Mount-Burke Theater, Richard L. Swig Arts Center, South Main Street, Hightstown. (609) 490-7550.

PRINCETON UNIVERSITY RICHARDSON AUDITORIUM The Richardson Baroque Players, Nancy Wilson, leader. Today at 3 p.m. Tickets: $10, $15 and $20; $2 for students. Princeton University Orchestra, Michael Pratt, conductor. Thursday and Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets $15; $5 for students. Princeton University Glee Club, Richard Tang Yuk, conductor, and the Harvard University Glee Club, Constance De Fotis, conductor. Friday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $15; $6 for students and older people. Concert Royal, James Richman, artistic director with New York Baroque Dance Company. Next Sunday at 3 p.m. Tickets: $27, $19; $5 for students. Alexander Hall, Princeton. (609) 258-5000.

PRINCETON UNIVERSITY TAPLIN AUDITORIUM Friends of Music event featuring Desiree Halac, mezzo-soprano, and Israel Gursky, pianist. Tuesday at 8 p.m. The Minneapolis Guitar Quartet. Next Sunday at 8 p.m. Free. Taplin Auditorium, Fine Hall. Washington Road, Princeton. (609) 258-4239.

RUTGERS UNIVERSITY - CAMDEN The Ahn Trio. Today at 7:30 p.m. Tickets: $15; $12 for students and older people. Gordon Theater. Cello quartet, featuring Talia Shiff. Wednesday at noon. Free. Mallery Room, Second Floor, Fine Arts Complex, Third Street between Cooper Street and the Benjamin Franklin Bridge, Camden. (856) 225-6176.

SAINT PETER THE APOSTLE CHURCH Organ recital, featuring J. Christopher Pardini, organist of the Crystal Cathedral in Garden Grove, California. Friday at 7:30 p.m. Free-will offering. 179 Baldwin Road (corner of Route 46 West), Parsippany. (973) 334-2090.

SETON HALL UNIVERSITY The Princton Singers present ''Folksongs and New Frontiers.'' Today at 3 p.m. Tickets: $15; $10 for older people; $5 for students. Kozlowski Hall, South Orange. (609) 924-4180 or (732) 780-7882.
STATE THEATER ''Philharmonia of the Nations.'' Friday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $25 to $45. Paul Anka. Next Sunday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $25 to $55. 15 Livingston Avenue, New Brunswick. (732) 246-7469.

STEVENS INSTITUTE OF TECHNOLOGY The Lyric Orchestra's special concert to benefit breast cancer research; Mayor Anthony Russo of Hoboken, guest conductor. Saturday at 7 p.m. Tickets: $25; $15 for students and older people. DeBaun Auditorium, Edwin A. Stevens Hall, 5th and Hudson Streets, Hoboken. (201) 216-8937.

STRAND THEATER Garden State Philharmonic's Gala Concert, featuring Yoichi Udagawa, guest conductor. Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $30, $26; $28, $24 for older people; $10, $8 for students. Fourth and Clifton Avenue, Lakewood. (732) 349-6277.

TRENTON WAR MEMORIAL Alice Cooper. Wednesday at 7:30 p.m. Tickets: $20 to $50. New Jersey Symphony Orchestra, ''Debussy and Brahms,'' Gerard Schwarz, conductor. Thursday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $15 to $61. Lafayette and Willow Streets, Trenton. (609) 984-8400.
WATCHUNG ARTS CENTER Marlene Verplank, jazz vocalist. Friday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $10. Watchung Circle, 18 Stirling Road, Watchung. (908) 753-0190.

WILLIAM PATERSON UNIVERSITY Fall 2000 Jazz Room Series: Jay Leonhart Trio. Today at 4 p.m. Tickets: $12, $9 for William Paterson community. 2000 Midday Artists' Series, featuring Jody Wise, pianist. Thursday at 12:30 p.m. Tickets: $3. The Orchestra at William Paterson University new season concert, featuring Jindong Cai, conductor, and Stewart Goodyear, guest pianist. Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $25, $20; $5 for students. Shea Center for Performing Arts, 300 Pompton Road, Wayne. (973) 720-2371.
THEATER

CENTENARY PERFORMING ARTS ''Blithe Spirit.'' Through Oct. 28. Performances are Fridays and Saturdays at 8 p.m.; Sundays and Wednesdays at 2:30 p.m.; and Thursdays at 7:30 p.m. Tickets: $15; $12.50 for children under 12. 400 Jefferson Street, Hackettstown. (908) 979-0900.

DREAMCATCHER REPERTORY THEATER ''Crumbs From the Table of Joy.'' Through Nov. 4. Thursdays through Saturdays at 8 p.m. Tickets: $20; $15 for students and older people. Van Fossan Theater, Bloomfield College, Franklin and Fremont Streets, Bloomfield. (973) 748-9008, ext. 995.
FORUM THEATER COMPANY ''Elephant Sighs.'' Through Nov. 5. Wednesdays and Sundays at 2 p.m.; Thursdays, Fridays and Saturdays at 8 p.m. Tickets: $28 to $32. 314 Main Street, Metuchen. (732) 548-0582.

GEORGE STREET PLAYHOUSE ''Wit,'' by Margaret Edson. Wednesday through Nov. 12. Performances are Tuesdays through Saturdays at 8 p.m.; Sundays at 2 p.m. and 7 p.m. Tickets: $24 to $40. 9 Livingston Avenue, New Brunswick. (732) 246-7717.
JOHN HARMS CENTER FOR THE ARTS ''Capitol Steps,'' musical and political satire. Thursday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $16 to $28. 30 North Van Brunt Street, Englewood. (201) 567-3600.

LUMIA THEATER The New Jersey Repertory Company presents ''In Search of Red River Dog.'' Through Nov. 5. Performances at Thursdays, Fridays and Saturdays at 8 p.m.; Sunday matinees at 2 p.m. Tickets: $25 to $27. 179 Broadway, Long Branch. (732) 229-3166.

LUNA STAGE ''Rapture,'' by Jeanne Marshall. Thursday through Nov. 12. Performances are Thursdays, Fridays and Saturdays at 8 p.m.; Sundays at 2 p.m. Tickets: $15 (Thursday); $22 (Fridays and Sundays); $18 (students and older people; $25 (Saturdays); $22 (students and old people on Saturdays). 7 Oak Place, Montclair. (973) 744-3309.

McCARTER THEATER Lily Tomlin in ''The Search for Signs of Intelligent Life in the Universe.'' Tuesday through Nov. 5. Tickets: $26 to $42. Center for the Performing Arts, 91 University Place, Princeton. (609) 258-2787.

MILL HILL PLAYHOUSE The Passage Theater Company presents ''Welcome Home Marian Anderson,'' written by and starring Vanessa Shaw. Thursday through Oct. 29. Call for show times. Tickets: $20; $17.50 for older people. Front and Montgomery Streets, Trenton. (609) 392-0766.

MONTCLAIR STATE UNIVERSITY ''The Boys Next Door.'' Thursday, Friday, Saturday and Oct. 26 to 28 at 8 p.m.; next Sunday at 2 p.m.; Oct. 27 at 1 p.m. Tickets: $10; $7 for faculty, staff, alumni and seniors; $5 for students. Studio Theater. Valley Road and Normal Avenue, Upper Montclair. (973) 655-5112.

NEW JERSEY CITY UNIVERSITY ''The Magic Flute,'' Mozart's opera. Today at 2:30 p.m. Tickets: $10; $5 for students and older people. Margaret Williams Theater, Hepburn Hall, 2039 Kennedy Boulevard, Jersey City. (201) 200-3280.

PAPER MILL PLAYHOUSE Jackie Mason, ''Much Ado About Everything.'' Tuesday, Wednesday and Friday at 8 p.m.; Thursday and Saturday at 2 p.m. Tickets: $40 to $75. Brookside Drive, Millburn. (973) 376-4343.

PARK THEATER ''Cuban Operator Please,'' presented by the Hudson Exploited Theater Company and the Park Performing Arts Center. Friday at 8 p.m.; next Sunday at 3 p.m. Tickets: $10 and $15. 560 32nd Street, Union City. (201) 865-6980, extension 20.
PARSIPPANY PLAYHOUSE ''Mack and Mabel.'' Today at 2 p.m.; Friday and Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $22; $17 for students; $15 for older people. 1130 Knoll Road, Parsippany. (973) 263-7020.

PREMIER THEATER COMPANY ''Joseph and the Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat.'' Through Oct. 28. Performances are Fridays and Saturdays at 8 p.m.; Sundays at 2 p.m. Tickets: $20; $18 for older people; $15 for students; $12 for children. Algonquin Arts Theater, 169 Main Street, Manasquan. (732) 223-7122.
RARITAN VALLEY COMMUNITY COLLEGE ''Capitol Steps,'' political satire. Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $22 and $27. Route 28 and Lamington Road, North Branch. (908) 725-3420.

RITZ THEATER ''Victor/Victoria.'' Friday through Nov. 18. Performances are Fridays and Saturdays at 8 p.m.; Sundays at 2 p.m.; Nov. 1 and 15 at 7:30 p.m. Preview performance on Thursday at 7:3 p.m. Tickets: $16 (Fridays and Saturdays); $12.50 (Sundays); $15 (Nov. 1 and 15); $10 (preview). 915 White Horse Pike, Oaklyn. (609) 858-5230.

RUTGERS UNIVERSITY - CAMDEN ''Sister Angelica,'' a one-act opera by Giacomo Puccini. Wednesday, Friday and Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $12; $8 for students and older people. The Gordon Theater Fine Arts Building, Third Street between Cooper Street and the Benjamin Franklin Bridge, Camden. (856) 225-6176.

RUTGERS UNIVERSITY ''The Scenario,'' suspense drama written by Michele Raper Rittenhouse. Thursday through Oct. 28. Performances are Thursdays, Fridays and Saturdays at 7 p.m.; Sundays at 2:30 p.m. Bradley Hall Theater, 110 Warren Street, Newark. (973) 353-5119, extension 17.
STATE THEATER Ballet Nacional de Caracas. Thursday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $20 to $32. 15 Livingston Avenue, New Brunswick. (732) 246-7469.
VAGABOND PLAYERS ''The Pirates of Penzance.'' Thursday, Friday and Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $12. Shore Hills Country Club, Morse Place, Landing. (973) 398-3565.

WINDSOR THEATER ''Waiting for the Sun, a Day in the After-Life of Jim Morrison and Friends,'' performed by the Accidental Art Ensemble. Thursday, Friday and Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $10. 247 Wanaque Avenue, Pompton Lakes. (973) 831-8240.
MUSEUMS AND GALLERIES

AFRICAN ART MUSEUM OF THE S.M.A. FATHERS ''African Containers: Clay, Gourd, Leather, Wood and Fiber'' and ''African Currency and Prestige Objects.'' Saturday through Dec. 2001. Opening reception: Saturday, 6 p.m. to 8 p.m. ''Eloquent Threads: The Language of African Costumes and Textiles.'' Through Dec. 31. Hours: daily, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. 23 Bliss Avenue, Tenafly. (201) 894-8611.

ATRIUM GALLERY ''Fanciful Visions,'' exhibition featuring a collection of paintings by Andrea Baruffi. Through Oct. 31. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 9 a.m. to 4 p.m. Chubb, 15 Mountain View Road, Warren. (908) 903-2608.

BARRON ARTS CENTER ''Vintage Motorcycles Exhibition.'' Through Nov. 5. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 11 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, 2 to 4 p.m. 582 Rahway Avenue, Woodbridge. (732) 634-0413.

COLLEGE OF NEW JERSEY ''Black Box Video Shorts.'' Through Nov. 8. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, noon to 3 p.m.; Thursdays, 7 to 9 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 3 p.m. College Art Gallery, Holman Hall, 2000 Pennington Road, Ewing. (609) 771-2198.

ENGLEWOOD PUBLIC LIBRARY ''Hispanic Heritage Month,'' highlighting works of Lidaenis Macrina Ferro, resident. Through Oct. Free. Hours: Mondays through Thursdays, 9 a.m. to 9 p.m.; Fridays and Saturdays, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, 1 p.m. to 5 p.m. 31 Engle Street, Englewood. (201) 568-2215.

GEORGIAN COURT COLLEGE ''A Creative Act of Genesis,'' exhibit of glass, fabric, print, collages and paintings by the Rev. Robert Terentieff. Through Oct. 30. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m.; weekends by appointment. 900 Lakewood Avenue, Lakewood. (732) 364-2200, extension 266.

HUNTERDON MUSEUM OF ART ''Runway: Photographs by Larry Fink,'' an exhibition of behind-the-scenes photos from the world of fashion and haute couture. Through Nov. 26. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. 7 Lower Center Street, Clinton. (908) 735-8415.

J.C.C. ON THE PALISADES ''Beijing Through the Mist of Time.'' Through Oct. 29. Hours: Monday through Thursday, 9 a.m to 10 p.m.; Friday and Sunday, 9 a.m. to 4 p.m. Waltuch Gallery, 411 East Clinton Avenue, Tenafly. (201) 569-7900, extension 433.

JERSEY CITY MUSEUM ''2000 Millennium Exhibition'' of the Jersey City Public Schools Permanent Student Art Collection. Wednesday through Dec. 1. Opening reception: Wednesday, 3:30 p.m. to 5 p.m. Hours: Tuesdays, Thursdays, Fridays and Saturdays, 10:30 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Wednesdays, 10:30 a.m.to 8 p.m. 472 Jersey Avenue, Jersey City. (201) 547-4514.

LIBERTY HALL MUSEUM ''Tea Is Served.'' A complete Afternoon Tea, in the style of Mary Alice Barney Kean, the last family to reside at Liberty Hall. Every Wednesday, 2 p.m. to 4 p.m. Cost: $15 per person; reservations required. Hours: Wednesdays through Sundays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. 1003 Morris Avenue (across from Kean University), Union. (908) 527-0400.

LIBERTY SCIENCE CENTER ''Extreme Deep: Mission to the Abyss.'' Through Jan. 7, 2001. ''Antarctica.'' Through Jan. 14, 2001. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, 9:30 to 5:30 p.m. Environment Level, Liberty State Park, 251 Phillip Street, Jersey City. (201) 200-1000.

MACCULLOCH HALL HISTORICAL MUSEUM ''Lasting Impressions,'' an exhibition on the history and techniques of printmaking. Through Jan. 14, 2001. Admission: $4; $3 for older people and students. Hours: Wednesdays, Thursdays and Sundays, 1 to 4 p.m. 45 Macculloch Avenue, Morristown. (973) 538-2404.

MONTCLAIR ART MUSEUM ''Lyrical Visions: Music and Dance in American and Native American Art.'' ''Georgia O'Keeffe: The Artist's Landscape, Photographs by Todd Webb.'' Through Jan. 7, 2001. ''Croquet: The Art of Play.' Through next Sunday (course will be open Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 5 p.m.) Admission: $7; $4 for children. Hours: Tuesdays, Wednesdays, Fridays and Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Thursdays and Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Admission: $5; $4 for older people and students; free for members and children under 12. 3 South Mountain Avenue, Montclair. (973) 746-5555.

MORRIS MUSEUM New Jersey Arts Annual: ''Everything for the Home'' juried exhibition. Through Nov. 17. ''Art and Nature: The Hudson River School'' exhibition. Through Nov. 19. Hours: Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m.; Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Thursdays to 8 p.m. Admission: $6; $4 for older people and children under age 3. 6 Normandy Heights Road, Morristown. (973) 538-0454.

NEW JERSEY HISTORICAL SOCIETY ''Resource-Full New Jersey,'' an exhibition on natural resources, past and present, and land-use consequences. Through 2002. ''Dining In, Dining Out,'' featuring photographs, video clips, rare silverware, period furniture and 18th-century cookbooks. Through summer 2001. ''Pride of Newark: Baseball's Bears and Eagles,'' about the history of baseball in Newark. Through March 2001. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. 52 Park Place, Newark. (973) 596-8500.

NEW JERSEY STATE MUSEUM ''Woven by Tradition and Design: A Selection of American Indian Weavings, Textiles and Baskets.'' Through Dec. 31. ''Click! The Marvelous in American Vernacular Photography.'' Through Dec. 31. ''Dinosaurs, Ammonites and Asteroids.'' Through Jan. 21, 2001. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 9 a.m. to 4:45 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Free. 205 West State Street, Trenton. (609) 292-6464.

NEWARK MUSEUM ''Night Skies: The Art of Deep Space,'' astral photographs by David Malin. Through Feb. 25, 2001. ''Katherine Choy: A Promise Unfulfilled'' ceramic showcase. Through Jan. 21, 2001. ''Treasures of 19th-Century American Art.'' Through Dec. 3. ''Year of the Dragon: The Calligraphy of Wang Fangyu.'' Through Nov. 12. ''Needless Necessity: Jewelry, Silver and Personal Meaning.'' Through December. Hours: Wednesdays through Sundays, noon to 5 p.m.; Thursdays (after hours) until 8:30 p.m. 49 Washington Street, Newark. (973) 596-6550.

NEWARK PUBLIC LIBRARY ''Diamond of Hope and Glory: The Life and Times of Latin Americans in the Negro Leagues.'' Through Dec. 2. Hours: Mondays, Fridays and Saturdays, 9 a.m. to 5:30 p.m.; Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursdays, 9 a.m. to 8:30 p.m. 2nd floor gallery, 5 Washington Street, Newark. (973) 733-7798.

NOYES MUSEUM OF ART ''Art in Boxes: Hers and His Stories.'' Through Jan. 7, 2001. ''Fred Returns: Selected Works of Fred Noyes From the Permanent Collection.'' Through Feb. 4, 20001. Hours: Wednesdays through Sundays, 11 a.m. to 4 p.m. Admission: $3; $2 for older people and students. Lily Lake Road, Oceanville. (609) 652-8848.

PRINCETON UNIVERSITY ART MUSEUM ''Dutch Prints in the Golden Age.'' Through Nov. 5. ''Life in the Fin de Siecle: Lithographs of Toulouse-Lautrec.'' Through Oct. 29. ''Surviving the Photograph.'' Tuesday through Nov. 19. ''Material Language: Small-Scale Sculpture after 1950.'' Tuesday through Dec. 30. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Princeton campus. (609) 258-3788.

RICHARD STOCKTON COLLEGE OF NEW JERSEY ''Watershed Landscapes,'' paintings by Alice McEnerney Cook. Through Oct. 26. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 11:30 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Tuesdays until 8 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 4 p.m. Gallery, Room H113, Jim Leeds Road, Pomona. (609) 652-4214.

RUTGERS UNIVERSITY - NEWARK ''Faces of the Ironbound: Newark 1937-1939.'' Through Dec. 14. Hours: Monday through Thursday, 8 a.m. to midnight; Friday, 8 a.m. to 7 p.m.; Saturday, 10 a.m. to 6 p.m.; Sunday, noon to 10 p.m. Dana Library, 185 University Avenue, Newark. (973) 353-5111.

SIMON GALLERY Suzanne Chamlin, pastels and mixed medial paintings. Through Nov. 11. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, noon to 6 p.m.; Saturdays, noon to 5 p.m.; other times by appointment. 48 Bank Street, Morristown. (973) 538-5456.

SWAIN GALLERIES Deborah Nieto Lieber, floral still lifes. Through Oct. 31. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 9:30 a.m. to 5:30 p.m.; Saturdays, 9:30 a.m. to 4 p.m. 703 Watchung Avenue, Plainfield. (908) 756-1707.

TRENTON CITY MUSEUM ''Eleanor A. Magid: Improvisational Bridges.'' Through Nov. 5. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 3 p.m.; Sundays, 2 to 4 p.m. Ellarslie, Cadwalader Park, Trenton. (609) 989-3632.

WILLIAMS GALLERY ''John Lennon and Yoko Ono -- A Double Fantasy: New Work by Allan Tannenbaum.'' Saturday through Nov. 18. Opening reception: Saturday, 5 p.m. to 7 p.m. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m.; other times by appointment. 8 Chambers Street, Princeton. (609) 921-1142.
FOR CHILDREN
DORBROOK ACTIVITY CENTER ''Fun With French.'' For children 5 to 6 years old. Thursdays at 1 p.m., through Oct. 26. Pre-registration is required. (732) 842-4000.
FORUM THEATER COMPANY ''The Legend of Sleepy Hollow.'' Through Nov. 4. Performances are every Saturday at 11 a.m. Tickets: $9. 314 Main Street, Metuchen. (732) 548-0582.

NEWARK MUSEUM ''Where in the Universe Is Carmen Sandiego?'' at the Alice and Leonard Dreyfuss Planetarium. Through October. Hours: Wednesdays through Fridays at 2:30 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, 1 p.m. and 3 p.m. Tickets: $3; $2 for members; $1 for children and older people. 49 Washington Street, Newark. (973) 596-6355.

NEW JERSEY PERFORMING ARTS CENTER ''Psyche,'' performed by the Mettawee River Company. Saturday at 2 p.m. For ages 12 and up. Tickets: $18; $9 for children. Victoria Theater, 1 Center Street, Newark. (888) 466-5722.

STATE THEATER ''Franklin's Big Adventure.'' Today at 1 p.m. and 4 p.m. Tickets: $14. ''Peter Pan.'' Saturday at 3 p.m. and 7 p.m. Tickets: $20 to $40. 15 Livingston Avenue, New Brunswick. (732) 246-7469.
SPOKEN WORD

BARNES & NOBLE Arlette N. Braman, author, will discuss and sign copies of her new book ''Traditional Native American Arts and Crafts.'' Wednesday at 7 p.m. Free. 1180 Raritan Road, Clark. (732) 574-1818.
BARNES & NOBLE Patricia Reilly Giff, author, will discuss and sign her new book ''Nory Ryan's Song.'' Tuesday at 7:30 p.m. Free. 753 Route 18, Brunswick Square, East Brunswick. (732) 432-0100.

BOOKENDS BOOKSTORE Robert Parker, author, will discuss and sign his new book ''Perish Twice.'' Today at 2 p.m. Joan Lunden, author and television personality, will discuss and sign her new book ''Wake-Up Calls: Making the Most Out of Every Day (Regardless of What Life Throws at You).'' Wednesday at 7 p.m. Free. 232 East Ridgewood Avenue, Ridgewood. (201) 445-0726.
BORDERS BOOKS AND MUSIC Terri Brisbin, author, will discuss and sign her new book ''Queen's Man.'' Tuesday at 7:30 p.m. Free. 515 Route 73 South, Unit 1, Marlton. (609) 985-5080.

RUTGERS UNIVERSITY Jennifer M. Moore, assistant United States attorney, will discuss ''Business, Ethics and the Eye of the Law: One Prosecutor's View'' for the second seminar in the Prudential Lecture Series. Friday at 2:30 p.m. Engelhard Lecture Hall, 190 University Avenue, Newark. (973) 353-5987.
ETC.

FAIR LAWN STREET FAIR Hundreds of exhibits of crafts, food, music and more. Today, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. Fair Lawn Avenue and Plaza Road in the Radburn area of Fair Lawn. (201) 796-7050 or (908) 996-3036.

FALL FINE ART AND CRAFTS AT BROOKDALE PARK SHOW Featuring more than 150 professional artists, craftspeople and photographers displaying and selling their hand-crafted work. Saturday and next Sunday, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Free. Watchung, Bellevue and Grove Avenues, Montclair. (908) 874-5247.

HOBOKEN ARTIST STUDIO TOUR Visit artists, photographers, sculptors and artisans in their studios. Self-guided walking tour features more than 100 participating artists. Today, noon to 6 p.m. Free. Tour maps available at City Hall, 94 Washington Street, between Newark and First Streets. (201) 420-2207.

SIX FLAGS GREAT ADVENTURE ''9th Annual Fright Fest.'' Friday evenings, Saturdays and Sundays through Oct. 29. Includes Halloween-themed rides, attractions, shows. Free with admission, $43.96 (adult); $21.98 (child). Northern Star Arena, exit 7A off the New Jersey Turnpike. (732) 928-1821.
At the Casinos
All tickets are available through Ticketmaster, (800) 736-1420.

BALLY'S PARK PLACE Natalie Cole. Friday at 10 p.m.; Saturday at 9 p.m.; next Sunday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $35 and $40. Main Ballroom. (609) 340-2709. ''Legends in Concert.'' impersonations of Stevie Wonder, Little Richard, Elvis Presley, Linda Ronstadt and Barbra Streisand. Mondays through Thursdays at 3:30 and 7:30 p.m.; Saturdays at 8 and 10:30 p.m.; Sundays at 7:30 and 10 p.m. Tickets: $15 to $25. Park Cabaret, Boardwalk and Park Place. (800) 225-5977.
CAESARS ATLANTIC CITY Howie Mandel. Friday at 10 p.m.; Saturday at 9 p.m.; and next Sunday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $45. Circus Maximus Theater, 2100 Pacific Avenue. (800) 677-7469.
